intro: Scorpiurus muricatus, commonly known as the rough hound's tongue, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant features a hairy, rough-textured stem and leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. Its small white flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Scorpiurus muricatus is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in temperate climates.
